issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After upgrading from the released 4.2.2 packages to the latest nightly 4.3.0 packages in http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/eucalyptus-devel/centos/6/x86_64/ on all nodes of an EQS cloud, restarting all the appropriate services on all nodes results in every component becoming available except objectstorage. The repeating error message in cloud-debug.log is:

{noformat}
Sun May 15 20:22:00 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class j\
ava.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#33] CHECK:null  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.77:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.77.obje\
ctstorage/ BROKEN->DISABLED=BROKEN [Action:ProblemAction Code:StartServiceType Id:RelatesTo Error: com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Transiti\
onException: OsgBootstrapper.start( ): failed because of: null, terminating bootstrap for component: objectstoragecom.eucalyptus.ut\
il.fsm.TransitionException: OsgBootstrapper.start( ): failed because of: null, terminating bootstrap for component: objectstorage]
{noformat}

There are no other helpful error messages before this point in the log. 

Note this does not seem to be the same issue as EUCA-11978 because the smoking gun of that issue (the string "ospClient" in cloud-debug.log) does not appear here.

Leaving that EQS cloud running (but services stopped to avoid logs flooding and rotating out):

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Current%20Public%20Release/46/
fields.summary: After 4.2.2 to 4.3 upgrade: Missing s3endpointheadresponse property prevents objectstorage service from coming up

comments.body: [~ccassler], [~tony], have you seen this issue in your upgrade tests?

[~vasya]: Yes, I just ran into this bug.  I have a CLC at 10.111.1.209 if you want to take a look at it.
{code}
[root@c-01 ~]# euserv-describe-services 
SERVICE  autoscaling           API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.autoscaling     enabled  
SERVICE  autoscalingbackend    eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  bootstrap             bootstrap         10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  cloudformation        API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.cloudformation  enabled  
SERVICE  cloudwatch            API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.cloudwatch      enabled  
SERVICE  cloudwatchbackend     eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  cluster               one               one-cc-1                         enabled  
SERVICE  compute               API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.compute         enabled  
SERVICE  dns                   API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.dns             enabled  
SERVICE  euare                 API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.euare           enabled  
SERVICE  eucalyptus            eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  identity              API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.identity        enabled  
SERVICE  imaging               API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.imaging         enabled  
SERVICE  imagingbackend        eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  jetty                 eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  loadbalancing         API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.loadbalancing   enabled  
SERVICE  loadbalancingbackend  eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  notifications         eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  objectstorage         API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.objectstorage   broken   
SERVICE  pollednotifications   eucalyptus        10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  reporting             bootstrap         10.111.1.209                     enabled  
SERVICE  simpleworkflow        API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.simpleworkflow  enabled  
SERVICE  storage               one               one-sc-1                         enabled  
SERVICE  tokens                API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220.tokens          enabled  
SERVICE  user-api              API_10.111.1.220  API_10.111.1.220                 enabled  
SERVICE  walrusbackend         walrus            walrus-1                         enabled  
{code}
cloud-error output:
{code}
Mon May 16 13:58:09 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#39] [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1322] START:DISABLED  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.1.220:objectstorage:API_10.111.1.220.objectstorage/ BROKEN->DISABLED=BROKEN [Action:ProblemAction Code:StartServiceType Id:RelatesTo Error: com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.TransitionException: OsgBootstrapper.start( ): failed because of: null, terminating bootstrap for component: objectstoragecom.eucalyptus.util.fsm.TransitionException: OsgBootstrapper.start( ): failed because of: null, terminating bootstrap for component: objectstorage]

Cannot generate client with no set endpoint
Mon May 16 13:58:19 2016 ERROR [ImageManifests:Eucalyptus.cluster:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.SubmitAllocation-10.111.1.209-one-cc-1/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#631] [com.eucalyptus.images.ImageManifests.requestManifestData(ImageManifests.java):122] Can't read manifest due to: com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Failed to initialize eucalyptus object storage client
Mon May 16 13:58:19 2016 ERROR [ClusterAllocator:Eucalyptus.cluster:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.SubmitAllocation-10.111.1.209-one-cc-1/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#631] [com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.cleanupOnFailure(ClusterAllocator.java):301] com.eucalyptus.compute.common.internal.util.MetadataException: com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Failed to read manifest file: eucalyptus-service-image-v1.57/eucalyptus-service-image.raw.manifest.xml
{code}
[~ccassler], thank you. Let me look if I can find anything on that system.

[~vasya] and [~swathi], I have a setup the captures this as well. CLC: 10.111.5.94, UFS 10.111.5.95

The root issue is that OSG could not find WalrusBackend via Topology
{code}
java.util.NoSuchElementException: Failed to lookup ENABLED service of type WalrusBackend.
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology.lookup(Topology.java:1034)
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.providers.walrus.WalrusProviderClient.check(WalrusProviderClient.java:212)
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.providers.s3.S3ProviderClient.initialize(S3ProviderClient.java:397)
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.providers.walrus.WalrusProviderClient.initialize(WalrusProviderClient.java:201)
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.ObjectStorageGateway.configure(ObjectStorageGateway.java:258)
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.bootstrap.OsgBootstrapper.start(OsgBootstrapper.java:109)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper$BootstrapperTransition$2.runBootstrapper(Component.java:685)
{code}
At the same time WalrusBackend is reported to end-user
{code}
[root@c-32 ~]# euserv-describe-services --filter service-type=walrusbackend
SERVICE  walrusbackend  walrus  walrus-1  enabled
{code}
[~sjones], [~jhalterman], this looks similar to the EUCA-11978. Do you see any reason why one component would not see another?
[~vasya] It does look similar, though EUCA-11978 has only occurred on single node installs, FWIW.

It looks like the issue for [~tony]'s setup could to be due to the osg configuration (s3endpointheadresponse) added for EUCA-11496 not being present after upgrade:

{code}
#
# euctl objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse
objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse = 
#
#
{code}

you could manually set the value to 405 (the default)

[~sjones], you're right: On the 1st EQS cloud that I had upgraded to 4.3 (http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Current%20Public%20Release/46/ ), there was no such property. I set the property to 405 manually, restarted eucalyptus-cloud, and objectstorage now says "enabled".

{noformat}
# euctl objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse
objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse =

# euctl objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse=405
objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse = 405

# euctl objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse
objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse = 405
{noformat}

{noformat}
SERVICE  objectstorage         API_10.111.5.77  API_10.111.5.77.objectstorage   enabled
{noformat}

On a newly deployed 4.2.2 cloud, there is no such property, as expected.

So, does [~swathi]'s code need to be adjusted?

[~lincoln.thomas], I suspect that I'm not using the correct javax persistence annotations. If thats the case, adding the correct annotation for updating the column and returning the value on a database transaction should be an easy fix. Another way of fixing the issue without having to set the property manually is by using upgrade logic. That should be straight forward as well. 

[~vasya], [~jhalterman]: This issue is not related to EUCA-11978 

[~tony]: I can fix the issue after I'm back from TechCon on Thursday. If it needs to be fixed before that, may be [~lincoln.thomas] could help

I assume that the objectstorage configuration is not modified on upgrade so the pre-persist callback is not used (until there is any other manual change)

I would add an upgrade task for this, the attached patch is an (untested) example of how this might look.

EDIT: I should have said pre-update callback (@PreUpdate) rather than pre-persist callback (@PrePersist) above.

[~swathi], [~sjones], I have new upgrade code in place for EUCA-11440 which I am testing during my upgrades. It's not being run (please see my comment today with code), maybe because of this issue? 

If I/we add upgrade code similar to what I added in EUCA-11440 (with the @PreUpgrade annotation), would that resolve both issues?
Thanks [~sjones]! (Ha, I added my comment just after you did, just read yours now.) Makes sense. I can add this and try it out today. Might explain my issue in EUCA-11440 too.
It worked with Steve's patch! I'll commit it to master. Thanks [~sjones].

Fix Verified.
After upgrade from 4.2.2 to 4.3.0 the property is present and initialized to "405"

before upgrade (no property)
